column4: I just sucessfulyl Installed Ubuntu, but as it gets to loading Gnome the screen goes Black and there is no HDD activity or anything of any sort
is there a way to reconfigure X?
can i do that booting the recovery kernel?
have you tried the command? I don't follow you, sorry

I just installed, and If i let GRUB boot normally, it goes up through everything okay, but when it goes to start X the screen stays black, this doesn't happen when I boot using the "recovery" option in GRUB
try typing the command I gave you at that prompt
if it's a root prompt you should not need the "sudo'
thanks, hopefully will return with results
choose the simple options and defaults
if you browse to it in nautilus does it show as a directory?
but in a terminal it shows as a directory, right?
are you sure you are looking at the same thing when you do it with the file browser?
ah - sp2 breaks stuff, from what I've heard
I don't know, but it's possible you are looking at a Windows problem rather than a linux one here
